Compilation on Unix or Windows, in a TEA compliant manner.

[ Compilation | Sitemap ]      

The TEA compliant Makefile, configure, etc., i.e. can be found in the subdirectory tea of the distribution. Apart from the different location the main points of the description for Unix apply here too.

One of the differences is that the TEA files can be used for compilation on Windows too, at least if the CygWin tools from Cygnus are present on that machine.

People restricted to tools provided by MS should still hike over to the Windows section of this documentation.
